info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Yavapai County along Interstate 40 through 600 PM MST... At 529 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Black Canyon City to near Rock Springs to near Crown King. Movement was south at 20 to 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Pleasant, Crown King, Black Canyon City, Rock Springs, Castle Hot Springs, Turney Gulch Group Campground and Hazlett Hollow Campground. This includes Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 252. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rainfall will lead to reduced visibility and slick roads, creating hazardous travel conditions. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
